enrichments.extra_info: Intermarché service areas typically cost €2 for tokens (purchased at store reception). Services include: free overnight parking, water refilling (10 minutes), electricity (1 hour), grey/black water disposal, laundry facilities, and car wash. Not all locations offer all services. Tokens not sold on Sundays/holidays at some locations. Available in France and Portugal.

Avia gas station LPG refilling point (France)

enrichments.extra_info: Country-specific adapters: Spain/Portugal (Euro connector/Jumbo), Germany/Austria/Belgium (ACME), France/Italy/Austria (Dish connector). Many stations require attendant assistance. CRITICAL: Always close bottle valve BEFORE disconnecting from pump to prevent gas release. Refillable systems (Gaslow, Gasit, Safefill) simplify the process. Adapters typically cost £20-50 for complete sets.

image_suggestions: Starlink Mini dish installed on motorhome roof
Temperature warning message on Starlink app showing 50°C limit
Starlink Mini in backpack showing portability
Proper shaded installation to prevent overheating
Starlink Mini with tripod stand setup
Size comparison showing compact design
enrichments.extra_info: Current pricing: $229 for hardware (down from $299), service plans with pause/unpause capability. Max download speeds over 100 Mbps, suitable for 100-150 sq ft spaces. Weight: under 22 pounds. CRITICAL: 50°C (122°F) max operating temperature - automatic disconnect when exceeded. Not suitable for unmanaged sun exposure in Mediterranean summer. Built-in WiFi router, DC power input, supports in-motion use. Standby Mode allows emergency messaging. Best used with shading and ventilation in hot climates.

enrichments.guide_title: Air Conditioning in Motorhomes: What Works and What Doesn't

references.name: Dometic Air Conditioners Official
references.description: Official Dometic RV air conditioners with advanced cooling technology

references.name: Amazon - Dometic RV Air Conditioners
references.description: Dometic RV air conditioners ranging from $600 to $1,400+

references.name: United RV Parts - Dometic Air Conditioners
references.description: Selection of Dometic rooftop RV air conditioners

references.name: Cool My Camper - Motorhome AC Systems
references.description: Cost-effective split pack AC system for campervans and motorhomes (450W, 1.88 amps)

references.name: Zero Breeze - Portable AC for RVs
references.description: Zero Breeze Mark 3 portable AC - 5,280 BTU, battery-powered, solar-compatible

image_suggestions: Dometic rooftop AC unit installed on motorhome
Small 3000 BTU portable AC (showing inadequate size)
Proper 7000+ BTU AC unit comparison
Multiple small fans distributed in motorhome interior
Door insulation foam layer installation
Temperature comparison: AC vs fan cooling
enrichments.extra_info: AVOID 3000 BTU portable units - completely insufficient for motorhomes. Minimum recommended: 7000-9000 BTU for typical 6m motorhome. Dometic products start at ~10,500 BTU. Alternative: multiple small powerful fans (more efficient, lower power consumption). Door insulation (foam layer like yoga mat) significantly improves AC efficiency. Heating works excellently in motorhomes even with small diesel heaters. Power consumption is critical constraint for off-grid living. Zero Breeze Mark 3 (5,280 BTU, 500W) offers solar-powered option.

enrichments.extra_info: Ron Kellner's proven system: 500 amp battery bank + 200 amp alternator. Renogy 200Ah Pro features: Bluetooth monitoring, IP67 waterproof, self-heating for sub-zero temps, 5000 cycles at 80% DOD. Can run 8000 BTU AC (1200W) without diesel engine. 2000W inverter sustains load until battery depletion with 90% efficiency. Complete 2kWh system includes 400W solar, 200Ah battery, 2000W inverter, 40A MPPT controller. Batteries support parallel connection (up to 8 units). Independent wiring from vehicle electrical system recommended for safety and easier troubleshooting.

enrichments.guide_title: Mouse Prevention and Odor Removal After Vehicle Storage

references.description: 360° coverage ultrasonic repellent for RVs, garages, warehouses - up to 3000 sq ft

references.name: Amazon - Angveirt Battery-Operated Rodent Repellent
references.description: Battery-operated ultrasonic repellent for car engines, RVs, attics - 65 days battery life

references.name: Amazon - Under Hood Rodent Repeller with Strobe Light
references.description: Triple power options (batteries/USB/hood connection), smart vibration sensing auto on/off

references.name: Amazon - 2025 Upgraded Mice Repellent with LED Strobe
references.description: Plug-in ultrasonic repellent with LED strobe lights, effective up to 1076 sq ft

references.name: RV Geeks - Best Mouse Repellents for RVs
references.description: Comprehensive guide to keeping rodents out of RVs with product recommendations

image_suggestions: Ultrasonic mouse repellent device installed in motorhome
Under-hood rodent repeller with strobe light
Mouse droppings identification guide
Proper ventilation setup for odor removal
Engine compartment protection installation
Battery-operated repellent placement diagram
enrichments.extra_info: Mice pose serious health hazards (hantavirus) and can cause thousands in damage by chewing wires. Ultrasonic repellents: safe for humans, cats, dogs; may affect hamsters, guinea pigs, rabbits. Coverage: 1076-3000 sq ft depending on model. Power options: plug-in (110V), battery-operated (65+ days), USB, or under-hood connection. Features: LED strobe lights, auto on/off with vibration sensing, no kills/traps/poisons. CRITICAL for long-term storage (6+ months). Complete ventilation required for odor removal. Consider professional pest control for severe infestations.

enrichments.guide_title: Water Tank Heating Systems for Motorhomes

references.name: ThermaHeat Tank Heating Pad with Thermostat (18x12)
references.description: Camper van water tank heating pad, thermostat turns on at 45°F/off at 67°F, protects 40 gal tanks

references.name: Amazon - Facon RV Tank Heater Pad
references.description: 12V DC tank heater pad with thermostat, prevents freezing for 50 gallon tanks, QAI certified

references.name: Kohree RV Tank Heater Pad with Thermostat
references.description: Thermostatically controlled heating pad for fresh, grey, and black water tanks

references.description: Various sizes of thermostatically controlled tank heater pads for RVs

image_suggestions: Tank heating pad installed on motorhome water tank exterior
Thermostat control unit display showing temperature
Proper heating pad placement diagram for different tank types
Peel-and-stick adhesive application process
Multiple pads connected in parallel for multiple tanks
Winter camping with heated water system
enrichments.extra_info: Modern heating pads use peel-and-stick adhesive for easy installation on tank exteriors. Thermostat activation: typically 42-45°F on, 67°F off. Protects tanks down to -2°C external temps. Suitable for fresh, grey, and black water tanks. Upgraded models heat 2X faster with tightly arranged heating wires. Can connect multiple pads in parallel. CRITICAL: Only activate when tank contains fluid - empty tanks may overheat and damage elements. Power options: 12V DC or 120V AC. Sizes: 12x18 inches common for 40-50 gallon tanks. Essential for Alpine/Dolomites/Pyrenees winter travel. Slim profile fits most tank configurations.

image_suggestions: Omnia oven three-part construction (base, container, lid)
Omnia in use on motorhome gas stovetop
Apple cake baking inside Omnia with visible layers
Heat circulation diagram showing top and bottom heating
Complete Omnia kit with silicone liner and storage bag
Omnia cooking comparison: bread, pizza, casserole results
enrichments.extra_info: Swedish design and manufacture. 3-part system: stainless steel base, aluminum food container (250mm diameter, 2.0L capacity, 70mm height), ventilated lid. Works on all heat sources: gas, electricity, kerosene. NO installation required. Heat redistribution creates circular baking chamber from single burner. Accessories: non-stick ceramic pan (PTFE-free, LFGB/FDA certified), silicone liners, storage bags. Temperature control by adjusting gas flame. Learning curve needed - each unit slightly different. Ideal for: breads, casseroles, cakes, pizzas. Very light, packs compactly for RV storage. User tip: 'After a while you learn the gas flame settings for required oven temp.'

references.description: PTC ceramic heater, 2 modes (800W/1000W), auto tip-over shutoff, 1.43 lb compact design

references.description: PTC ceramic heater with thermostat, under 45 decibels, heating and fan modes

references.description: Digital display bathroom heater, adjustable thermostat and timer, compact 3.9x3.5x6.5 inches

image_suggestions: Compact 800W ceramic heater in motorhome cabin area
Size comparison showing portability (5.5x5.5x3.9 inches typical)
Heater with thermostat control and digital display
Proper placement for supplemental heating (not blocking vents)
Shore power connection setup for AC heater use
Tip-over safety feature demonstration
enrichments.extra_info: Budget-friendly option for supplemental heating when connected to shore power (110V AC). NOT suitable for off-grid/battery operation - would drain 12V quickly. Typical features: PTC ceramic heating, silent operation (<45 dB), automatic overheat shutoff, tip-over protection, adjustable thermostat. Compact size: 3.9-5.5 inches typical, weight 1.43 lb. Two modes common: 800W (gentle) + 1000W/1200W (rapid). LIMITATIONS: 800W insufficient for full motorhome on cold nights - best as auxiliary/supplemental heating. Requires AC hookup at campgrounds. Works well for driver's cabin area. Safety certified with automatic shutoff. Alternative: 24V car heaters available for DC systems.

references.description: Ultimate guide to campervan LPG ovens with comparisons and recommendations

image_suggestions: HAJKA oven on gas stovetop showing compact 6x23cm packed size
Heat distribution diagram showing uniform vs. radiant heating
Pizza being baked in HAJKA (3 minute cook time)
Sourdough bread loaf in HAJKA oven
HAJKA vs Swedish stove (Rote Herd) comparison
Multiple fuel compatibility: gas, alcohol, diesel, ember
Tristar electric oven alternative for shore power use
enrichments.extra_info: HAJKA: Swedish-designed, weighs 750g, packs to 6x23cm. Compatible with ALL fuels: gas, alcohol, gasoline (multifuel), diesel burners, even ember. Fixed motorhome stoves and portable camping stoves. Fits Trangia (large/small). Bakes pizza in 3 minutes, handles 1kg fish/meat. Temperature controlled by flame level - learning curve needed. £117 price point. Comparison: Swedish stove (Rote Herd) has large central air passage for radiant heat concentration; HAJKA provides better uniform distribution for even baking. ALTERNATIVE: Tristar electric ovens (OV-3615 10L, OV-3622 19L) at 800W - perfect for inverters/power stations, suitable for 220V campground hookups. Tristar: adjustable 100-230°C, 60-minute timer, double glass door, CE certified.
